description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3gb25","text":"Galleria mellonella larvae have been increasingly used in various scientific research, including microbial infection studies. They act as suitable preliminary infection models to study host-pathogen interactions due to their advantages, such as the ability to survive at 37 Â°C mimicking human body temperature, their immune system shares similarities with mammalians, etc. Here, we presented a protocol for simple rearing and maintenance of Galleria mellonella in science research laboratories without requiring special instruments and specialised training. This allows the continuous supply of healthy Galleria mellonella for research purposes. Besides, this protocol also provides detailed procedures on the (i) Galleria mellonella infection assays (killing assay and bacterial burden assay) for virulence studies and (ii) bacterial cell harvesting from infected larvae and RNA extraction for bacterial gene expression studies during infection. Our protocol could not only be used in the studies of A. baumannii virulence but can also be modified according to different bacterial strains. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":109,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bo9fi","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3u1sj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lqjn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3922ECA077A611ED858EAFEB033FBA54","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4m9ae","text":"The larvae must be used within 2 weeks.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Galleria mellonella rearing and maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"btkqi","text":"Transfer 50 pupae (brownish colour) or larvae in the pre-pupal stage (with thick cocoons) into a moth jar using blunt-end forceps and cover with filter paper and a perforated lid. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rse","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"daihe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"fte1m","text":"NOTE: ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"46g90","text":"Pupae are very fragile. Therefore, extreme care is needed to avoid punctures.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"feic2","text":"Male and female moths will mate 2-3 days after they appear.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Galleria mellonella rearing and maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bum2c","text":"Female moths will lay eggs around the filter paper. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Galleria mellonella rearing and maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"16ju9","text":"Replace the filter paper (that has eggs on it) with a new filter paper. This should be performed every 3 days to avoid the escape of newly hatched larvae. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Galleria mellonella rearing and maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4s5la","text":"The moth jars should be cleaned after 2 weeks the first moth appeared to avoid the escape of newly hatched larvae. This can be done by placing the moth jars in a cold room ( )  . Transfer the moths into a plastic bag and freeze them at    . Discard as biological waste.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":173,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":176,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":236,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":238,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"tfb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B6765C0077A611ED858EAFEB033FBA54","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"B08AD18177A611EDAF240A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3C1D65557FA411EDA66B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3C1D66267FA411EDA66B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Galleria mellonella rearing and maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"81n6l","text":"Cut the collected filter paper (with eggs) into smaller pieces and transfer it into the egg jar with food.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91khf","text":"Discard areas with contamination. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u9l","text":"Cover the egg jar with a perforated lid. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t8re","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d744p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"fkglg","text":"NOTE:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1tv8c","text":"Extreme care is needed as the eggs can easily burst. ","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e4gfh","text":"Applying a layer of VaselineÂ® petroleum jelly at the wall of the egg jars is highly recommended to prevent the newly hatched larvae from escaping.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Galleria mellonella rearing and maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"961h2","text":"Egg jars should be monitored every 3 days to ensure a continuous food supply until they grow into the adult stage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Galleria mellonella rearing and maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9k7vp","text":"Separate the medium into half using blunt-end forceps and put it into two jars when it is too crowded. Top up the medium with freshly prepared food.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Galleria mellonella rearing and maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"43r1k","text":"Transferring the larvae individually into a new jar with freshly prepared food might be necessary when the medium has fungal contamination or an unusual smell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Galleria mellonella rearing and maintenance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3en3b","text":"When the larvae grow bigger, transfer medium and large larvae (approx. 1.5 cm and 2 cm) to a new jar with food and cover with cloth-type voile and perforated lids.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
